title: Onsite launches IPO with price, terms pending
text:
ASX hopeful Onsite Rental Group has sent a 205-page pathfinder document explaining the business and its proposed initial public offering to potential investors, but there is no mention of the two things that will make the deal sink or swim.

Onsite took the unusual step of launching its IPO management roadshow, complete with the chunky draft prospectus and 45-page management presentation, without any details on the deal's price or structure on Monday.

Former Elders boss Malcolm Jackman is slated for a board seat at Onsite Rental Group. Michelle Mossop

While fund managers took it as a reflection of the IPO environment, which is looking a bit shaky, they were told to expect an update late this week which should put some numbers around the proposed deal.

It is understood the hold-up has come because Onsite's existing investors – a group of mostly US-based funds that took part in a recapitalisation in 2017 – are yet to formally elect what stake to sell into the IPO and at what price.

That process is expected to play out in coming days and fundies are keen to see where the numbers end up.
description: Onsite Rental Group has launched its IPO management roadshow with no mention of price or structure.
